reviewText:
I bought this because I play alot of ArmA 2. I liked and played Red Orchestra 2 a bit too but RO 2 just left me wanting something deeper. I've read alot of negative reviews but I have to say that this is a great game for alot of reasons.
The first things that's gonna hit you is that it's really just ArmA 2 set in WW2 but all the things that made ArmA 2 great make this game great too. There are thousands of little hidden surprises to discover.
Sure there werent alot of people in servers but just like ArmA 2 i just created my own offline server and the game filled it with bots just like Arma 2. For me that means infinite replay value. (and thats before i even get to the campaign or scenarios.)
Some people say this game is more system heavy but it looks just like Arma 2 to me...what i did notice was that the game lagged out on the Normandy D-day scenario...just too much going on for the game to handle..everything else ran fine though.

The skins and weapons look fantastic and flying those ww2 fighters is more fun than ever...youd swear you were playing IL2 sturmovic.

Straight away I can see that this game is going to give me months of single player replay value just like ArmA 2.
Many people complain about jittery controls on the Arma Games...all i can say is that if you have a decent PC and dial in the game then it runs smooth and accurate. I always turn of all post processing and anti liasing, mouse smoothing etc because I want the controls to be as fast and accurate as possible. The game still looks great and it's as responsive as any FPS if you do that.

This game really is a real WW2 simulator. Open world and huge. All the things that RO2 aspired to be but didnt quite achieve.
Like any game there will be the odd bug or two but I'm very glad i got this game (in the christmas sale)

Yes..you will probably have trouble finding online players but if like me you just wanted single player with infinite replay value then this game definitely hits that mark. Personally I don't care if nobody knows about this game, to me it just makes it one of those hidden gems that is enjoyed by a select few. I've not played the 1944 Arma 2 mod people are referring to here, but now that I have this game I dont see why Id need to...this game has everything I wanted.

reviewText:
7.8/10
+Realistic
+Massive Maps
+Extremely Customizable
+Intense Combat
-Clunky Controls
-Dumb AI
-Graphical Inconsistancies

I think this game gets too bad of a reputation from those who pick it up for the first time. Let me preface this with a couple of things: Yes, it does have bugs, Yes it does have graphical inconsistancies (Low res textures, shoddy character modeling, etc), Yes, it does have a complicated control scheme, and yes the AI isn't exactly top notch. With all of this in mind I still would recommend this game; not to players who are familiar with fast paced shooters like Team Fortress, Call of Duty, Battlefield, or anything like that, but to those who are looking for a realistic, stategical, satisfying tactical experience.

Let me address the first problem many players complain about: The control scheme. To be honest, I don't get what the big deal is. I mean if we are talking bare-bones-pick-up-and-play-with-no-prior-knowledge-of-the-controls gameplay, you WILL find that it is a bit clunky, but if you stop and go to the settings, you can customize the control scheme virtually to any way you want. There are a lot of actions that you will not use, so simply map those away from the main controls. You have the ability to map buttons to the same command, making them toggleable. So realistically, just map the controls to the way you are used to them and everything will be fine.

This game offers an assortment of different units, guns, and vehicles to play with. All are historically accurate and accuratly designed. The sound captuing is a little iffy, as most weapons sound the same. This game drops you in the shoes of either a German soldier, or a Russian soldier (or an American if you buy the DLC). The maps the missions take place in are rather huge, and the gameplay time from mission to mission can vary from 10 minutes, to 2 hours, depending on how you play. The  battles feel very realistic. This game can prove to be very difficult to those who like to run out into the open and play super hero. The good/ bad thing about that, is that you will have to start from the last checkpoint if you die, so this game forces you to move slowly and assess the situation.

You are in control of your AI team mates most of the time. This is the only instance where the controls, for me, got clunky. To select a unit, you will push the F1-F12 buttons, and to issue a command, you will find it by pushing the 1-0 keys. In the middle of a firefight, this can become tedious, and will often result in you either picking the wrong command, or scrolling through the number keys to find the command. It also doesn't help that the AI react slowly, so if you tell them to hit the dirt, or give suppressive fire, they will think about it for about ten seconds before acting, but this is only when there are many units on the field at once.

While I do not have the patience to describe every aspect of the game, I can tell you that this game has flaws, but if you are looking for a good, strategic game, this is the one to buy. It needs work, and I hope they make a second one with fewer bugs.

reviewText:
This game is a lot of fun and I'm a huge fan of the genre. I've played Arma 2 for many hours, and feel like I can play this one for the equal amount of time. There are a lot of problems though.
Pros:Very fun if you like the genre.
You can sometimes be killed by stray rounds, like in real war.
It can't really be scripted to be exact, meaning anything can happen any any time. Murphy's Law is here.
You can play with a different guns vehicles etc. You can play with both airplanes and tanks in the same battle.(Also infantry.)
My favorite_____The editor lets you build any game you want. You want a massive tank/plane/infantry battle with 200+ guys on each side, you can do it. Do you want to make a mission where you assassinate a Nazi/Soviet/American leader, you've got it.

CONS: Terrible engine, just like the others in Arma 2 etc.
Glitches happen way too often. One time I set up a massive game air/land battle between Soviets and Germans. I was playing as a Soviet Rifle men when I noticed German tanks 20 feet from me, yet no had fired a shot. Neither side lost any men, even though they went right by each other. I ran across the field and shot a German soldier, and none of his friends even reacted. They just laid there while I executed them in the middle of a field surrounded by other Germans with rifles. Needless to say a glitch made the armies ignore one another.
The grenade system is poor.
It feels like the Devs got a little lazy on the creating vehicles front. There are only two airplanes types per nation. The Sherman is used by Soviets and Americas, even though the Soviets have none of the KVs. Americans only have the Sherman as a tank. I've seen mods created by average Joes that are leagues better than this entire game. There are also no mods, because the devs thought it was a bad idea or some stupid ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.

reviewText:
As far as having a virtual WW2 battlefield this game delivers.  The single player campaign is lacking though.  Its worth a punt but it's clumsy, but it does have its moments.

The real single player benefit is generating your own battles.  The ability to jump from different player positions is awesome;  for example, it is easy to set up a defence of various German emplacements, be it Pak guns, machine guns, tanks, squads etc,  than let the Russian onslaught commence.  If one position you are manning is destroyed just move on to another unit.

Tank battles are particularly good and make up for the lack of decent WW2 tank games.  Especially as you can quickly mould a battle as you wish in teh editor.  Need another bunch of T34's ?  It takes seconds to add them to the mission generator.

Graphics are good too.  At times photo realistic.

If you are into WW2 stuff, and long for the ability to recreate WW2 battles with numerous tanks, guns, planes and inftantry this game is for you.

Just dont reply on the single player missions.

This game deserves more kudos in my opinion, I highly recommend it.

Iron Front is a simulator, not counter strike and not Call of Duty. It's a WW2 simulator with the focus on infantry tactics. You can use tanks, vehicles and planes, but they're not 1:1 simulated. Good, but not prefect.

The power of Iron Front comes from the close to real approach of the correct presentation of all uniforms, ranks, languages (with dialects) and human dialogs.

The game shows you, during the campaign, that war is no place for heroes and that you're as good as dead if you think that you're the best fps gamer in the world, because you know how to play candy strike ehm..sorry..counter strike.

If you like hard core gameplay, stick to this. Many features, many options, but brutal as hell. If you want to brag about you kills and upgrades, stay away. There're none in this game. And it does matter if you kill some one to make sure he's alone. You don't want to fight a squad of angry soldiers on your own.

NOTE: You do need a rather high-end game rig for this game, otherwise it won't run smooth enough. But, if you got that.. Nothing stands in your way to enjoy this Red Orchestra killer. Ofcourse, all a matter of taste, but this is my nr. 1 favorite World War 2 Co-Op Simulation.

reviewText:
ONLY BUY THIS GAME WHEN IT IS ON SALE, IT IS NOT WORTH THE $25 DOLLARS THEY ARE CHARGING FOR IT, EVEN IF YOUR COPY CAN EVEN ACTUALLY RUNS LIKE IT SHOULD.

I was incredibly torn over choosing to negatively review this game. It has such promise, and offers the ARMA immersion in a world war 2 setting. Also all the weapons, vehicles, and uniforms appeared to be very realistic.

That being said, this game does have its fair share of bugs. My biggest problem was with the graphics, as they appear to require a super computer to run on maximum. I dont have a top of the line gaming comuter, but I can run battlefield 4 at nearly 40 fps. On this game I had to set everything to low to even get around 24fps, and at that point textures were also flickering out and not loading. Simply, it is a great game idea and has the contents to make it really enjoyable, but there  are a few technical issus that can potentially make it unplayable. I wish that Steam reviews had a neutral button becasue that is how I truly feel about this game.

reviewText:
Building on the rather pretty ArmA 2 engine, this game moves the ArmA experience to the second world war.
Dedicated ArmA players may already know that scenario from mods like Invasion '44, but here you have a very polished take on the eastern front. It may not be as good as the first Red Orchestra, but it certainly is a lot simpler to get into, and it is a LOT more beautiful.
However, like ArmA 2 after release, this game is still full of bugs, issues, and crashes, even though the ArmA 2 engine is running pretty stable, at least I haven't had any ArmA 2 crashes I couldn't explain (since I've been coding some C++ lately, my ArmA 2 has crashed a lot in the past week :P).
All in all it seems solid, but constant crashing prevented me from taking a closer look then a few missions into the German campaign.
Hands off until the crashing has been patched!

reviewText:
Do not be fooled by the negative reviews, this game isnt all bad.

This game is good, but has its faults....
With the D-Day expansion, you can relive your favorite battles of WW2, say you are interested in D-Day, well guess what? you can play through it? This is probably the only good WW2 TACTICAL shooter. It is an okay game, and I highly suggest you get this game if you want.

on the other hand....

It is REALLY laggy. No matter what computer you have, it is still going to be, most likely, really laggy, it is just what the game does. I purchased this when it was on sale fro mthe original price being $20.00, so I am glad to see the price go down. The game also has little to NO community for multiplayer, the few multiplayer groups require you to download sketchy looking files, and go to sketchy websites, and I would not reccomend them. Its multiplayer is flawed with several glitches and bugs that almost make it impossible to play.


All in all, this game is not all bad, and you can still have fun playing its singleplayer missions and using the map editor, where you can create costum missions. It is a 5/10 in my opinion.
